title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Thomas P. Jackson to R. M. Manly, November 4, 1867
summary: Jackson's letter to Manly states that John Scott will be coming to teach in Staunton, but that Miss Rowell refuses to serve as his assistant. Jackson asks Manly to provide new assignments for Miss Rowell and her assistant.
keywords: Education, Aid/Relief, Women, American Civil War
